intro: Batrachium luteolum, commonly known as the yellow batrachium, is a species of flowering plant native to parts of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its yellow-orange flowers and hairy, ovate leaves. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and wetlands. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for study in tropical botany.
